header.title: Bank of Mexico CoDi API
header.description: Open-source API that enables Mexican businesses to generate payment requests through Mexico's Central Bank CoDi system. Zero transaction fees, immediate deposits, bank-level security, and comprehensive documentation.

overview.heading: Project Overview
overview.para1: CoDi API is a production REST API that solves a critical problem for Mexican businesses: accepting digital payments without paying high transaction fees. Traditional payment processors charge 2-4% per transaction (plus 16% VAT), which can significantly impact profit margins, especially for small businesses.
overview.para2: By integrating directly with Banxico's CoDi system, this API enables businesses to accept payments from any Mexican bank account through QR codes or push notifications to mobile banking apps, with zero transaction fees.

overview.highlight1Text: Live API actively processing real payments
overview.highlight4Text: RSA digital signatures and certificate authentication
overview.highlight6Text: Interactive playground, code generators, and detailed guides
overview.highlight7Text: Built specifically for Mexico's payment infrastructure

whatIsCodi.heading: What is CoDi?
whatIsCodi.para1: CoDi (Cobro Digital) is Mexico's Central Bank official digital payment system, launched in 2019 to promote financial inclusion and provide a modern alternative to cash and card payments.
whatIsCodi.howWorksPara: Unlike traditional payment processors, CoDi operates directly through the banking system. When a customer makes a CoDi payment, the money transfers instantly from their bank account to the merchant's bank account, with no intermediaries taking a cut.
whatIsCodi.paymentMethodsIntro: The system supports two payment methods:
whatIsCodi.method1Text: Customer scans a QR code with their banking app to authorize the payment
whatIsCodi.method2Text: Payment request is sent directly to the customer's mobile banking app
whatIsCodi.benefit1Text: No commissions charged to merchants or customers
whatIsCodi.benefit3Text: Complete audit trail of all transactions
whatIsCodi.benefit4Text: Protected by the same security measures as online banking
whatIsCodi.workflowCaption: 3-Step CoDi Payment Process: Generate payment request, customer authorizes, instant confirmation

architecture.heading: Technical Architecture
architecture.para1: The CoDi API is built as a Node.js/Express middleware layer that handles the complex authentication and communication with Banxico's payment infrastructure, exposing a simple REST API to client applications.
architecture.simplifiedCaption: Simplified architecture overview showing the main components and data flow
architecture.componentsIntro: The system consists of several key layers:
architecture.component1Text: Handles incoming requests, validation, and responses
architecture.component2Text: Manages RSA digital signatures and certificate validation
architecture.component4Text: Multiple endpoint support with automatic retry logic
architecture.component5Text: Stores API keys, payment records, and audit logs
architecture.component6Text: Delivers real-time payment confirmations to client applications
architecture.detailedCaption: Detailed architecture diagram showing complete data flow from client application through CoDi API to Banxico
architecture.requestFlowIntro: Here's what happens when a client application requests a payment:
architecture.flow1: Client sends POST request with payment details (amount, description, etc.)
architecture.flow2: API validates request and authenticates using API key
architecture.flow3: Payment data is signed with RSA certificate
architecture.flow4: Signed request is sent to Banxico CoDi system
architecture.flow5: Banxico generates QR code or sends push notification
architecture.flow6: API stores transaction record in PostgreSQL
architecture.flow7: Response is returned to client with QR code or confirmation
architecture.flow8: When customer pays, webhook notification is sent to client's callback URL

features.heading: Key Features
features.intro: The CoDi API provides six major features, each designed to make digital payment integration as simple as possible while maintaining enterprise-grade security and reliability.
features.qrPara: Generate CoDi-compliant QR codes that customers can scan with any Mexican banking app. The QR codes are dynamic, meaning they contain all the payment information and can expire after a specified time.
features.qr3: Include custom reference numbers and descriptions
features.qr4: Base64-encoded QR code returned in API response
features.pushPara: Send payment requests directly to a customer's mobile banking app using their phone number. The customer receives a notification and can authorize the payment with a single tap.
features.push1: Instant delivery to customer's banking app
features.queryPara: Check the status of any payment using its unique folioCoDi reference number. This enables real-time payment verification and transaction history tracking.
features.webhookPara: Receive automatic notifications when payments are completed. Configure a callback URL, and the API will POST payment confirmation data to your server when a customer pays.
features.securityPara: Enterprise-grade security features protect both the API and your payment data. Every request to Banxico is digitally signed with RSA certificates, and all communications are encrypted.
features.docsPara: Comprehensive documentation with interactive tools makes integration straightforward, even for developers new to payment processing.

devExperience.heading: Developer Experience
devExperience.intro: A great API needs great documentation and tools. The CoDi API includes a comprehensive documentation site with interactive features that make integration faster and debugging easier.
devExperience.playgroundPara: Test all API endpoints directly from your browser without writing any code. The playground includes pre-filled examples and validates your requests in real-time.
devExperience.playgroundCaption: Live API playground for testing QR generation, push notifications, and payment queries
devExperience.generatorPara: Generate ready-to-use integration code in multiple programming languages. Simply select your endpoint and language, and get production-ready code examples.
devExperience.generatorCaption: Code generator supporting cURL, JavaScript (Fetch), and Python (requests)
devExperience.tool4Text: Detailed explanations of all error responses

database.heading: Database Architecture
database.intro: The API uses Supabase (PostgreSQL) for data persistence, with a schema that supports multiple customers, comprehensive audit logging, and payment tracking.
database.schemaPara: The database consists of 5 core tables that work together to manage customers, API keys, payment transactions, and comprehensive audit logging:
database.schemaCaption: Database schema diagram showing the 5 core tables and their relationships
database.integrity1: Foreign key constraints ensure referential integrity
database.integrity2: Timestamp columns track creation and updates
database.integrity3: Environment segregation prevents test/production data mixing
database.integrity4: Indexed queries for fast payment lookups

securityDeep.heading: Security Features Deep Dive
securityDeep.intro: Security is paramount when handling financial transactions. The CoDi API implements multiple layers of security to protect sensitive payment data and ensure compliance with banking regulations.
securityDeep.signaturePara: Every request to Banxico is digitally signed using RSA certificates. This ensures that Banxico can verify the request originated from an authorized CoDi API instance and hasn't been tampered with.
securityDeep.validationPara: The API validates RSA certificates by comparing serial numbers and verifying certificate authenticity before accepting any requests. This prevents unauthorized access even if someone obtains a valid API key.
securityDeep.ipPara: The system implements strict IP whitelisting across three security layers to ensure only authorized clients can access the payment infrastructure:
securityDeep.ip1Text: Network-level IP filtering blocks unauthorized traffic before it reaches the application
securityDeep.ip2Text: Application-level IP validation ensures only registered client IPs can make API requests
securityDeep.ip3Text: Banxico requires pre-registered IP addresses for all CoDi system connections, providing an additional security checkpoint
securityDeep.ipConclusion: This multi-layered IP restriction architecture ensures that even with valid credentials, access is only possible from approved network locations, significantly reducing the attack surface.
securityDeep.keyPara: API keys are 128-character hexadecimal strings stored securely in Supabase. Each key is linked to a specific customer and environment (Beta or Production), with individual rate limits and permissions.
securityDeep.sanitizationPara: All incoming requests are sanitized to prevent SQL injection, XSS attacks, and other common vulnerabilities. Input validation ensures only properly formatted data reaches the Banxico integration layer.
securityDeep.rateLimitPara: The API implements rate limiting to prevent abuse and ensure fair resource allocation. The default limit is 200 requests per 15-minute window per API key.
securityDeep.headersPara: Helmet.js adds security headers to all responses, protecting against common web vulnerabilities like clickjacking, XSS, and content type sniffing.

apiEndpoints.heading: API Endpoints Reference
apiEndpoints.intro: The CoDi API exposes 5 main endpoints for managing digital payments. All endpoints require API key authentication via the x-api-key header.

useCases.heading: Use Cases
useCases.intro: The CoDi API is versatile and can be integrated into a wide variety of business applications. Here are the most common use cases:
useCases.ecommercePara: Online stores can integrate CoDi as a payment option at checkout, offering customers a commission-free alternative to credit cards.
useCases.posPara: Physical retail locations can use CoDi for in-person payments, displaying QR codes at the counter or sending push notifications.
useCases.servicePara: Service-based businesses can request payments remotely via push notifications, perfect for recurring billing or on-demand services.
useCases.marketplacePara: Multi-vendor platforms can use CoDi to handle peer-to-peer transactions between buyers and sellers.

openSource.heading: Open Source & Community
openSource.intro: The CoDi API is open source under the Apache 2.0 license, which means you can use it commercially, modify it, distribute it, and even patent it, with minimal restrictions.
openSource.license1Text: Use the API in commercial products without fees
openSource.license2Text: Customize the code to fit your specific needs
openSource.contributingPara: Contributions are welcome! Whether you're fixing bugs, adding features, improving documentation, or reporting issues, your help makes the project better for everyone.
